Posts.Content: Hope to be joining the may group, just popped on to say I have been told no I can't have R1 R2 cream. Onco said they don't use it, GP said it us not on her list and needs a consultant to tell her to put it on, breast care nurse said she would never go over oncos head. So looks like if I want it I will have to pay for it. Not fair me thinks, only one more person to ask and that is radiotherapist but don't think I will get much joy from him if all the others have said no. Stay strong ladies
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi everyone No R1 orR2 cream for me, been told no by oncologist, GP and BCN, but on a positive note my BCN did ask me what they were called, she called me after a couple of days and said she can see why I wanted them and had called the radiotherapist to see If they knew about them, they said no but promised her they would have a look into the creams.  So maybe I will not get them but hope those that come after me might. Should be joining the May club.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Waiting is the hardest part hun Alone in the dark is when your thoughts can overwhelm you, don't panic and breathe, I found I had to get out of bed and do something, make a cake, crochet, crossword or just hot drink and 're run of dad's army or only fools and horses. You will get past the scared shitless stage, if it's something that needs more treatment your survival mechanism will kick in and you will arm yourself for the battle ahead. We are all here to help you  Stay strong
Posts.Title: Awaiting breast biopsy results feel like I'm going mad

Posts.Content: Miss Wolfie hey hun, scared is ok, think this was and still is the scariest thing I have ever been through.  Side effects can be quite bad sometimes but you just have to keep telling yourself it's not for long.  Sometimes I think it can be worse for those closest to us to have to watch us.  All I can say is whatever side effect it is, someone on here has had it before you and will have found a solution that helped. I used to think I would never feel normal again, in a way I don't, I have a new normal now. On 9th April I will be 1 year on from my last Doxetaxol. There were times when I thought I could not do it but this site and all the lovely people kept me going. I hope you have a good support network with friends and family as that helps. But all in all I think this site was my saviour as we were all going through it together and I got so much advice and support from others.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Beachwalker19 Bless ya I know what that is like.  All I can advise is talk to chemo unit, I did and they prescribed codeine and paracetamol together as the bone pain was unbearable. Once I got through that cycle I started to take a antihistamine tablet ( loratadine only) which can help with bone pain. And chemo nurse changed my injections from filgrastim to lenograstim and I coped much better.  Don't suffer tell someone. Good luck
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thinking about the nail polish debate, dark polish can cover discoloration. My problem was very sore nails while I had chemo.  I managed to keep my nails at a good length the whole time and always wore nail polish.  My chemo nurse told me my nail bed would be damaged from chemo and when I looked closely I had 6 very deep ridges in my nails one for each chemo I had. This did not cause a problem until after as the first ridge started to reach the tip of my nail bed, it would seem my nails were very soft around the ridges and one of them came off almost completely. 1 year on all the ridges have grown out and I have healthy nails again.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Tastebuds do suffer on Docetaxel, everything tastes strange and some things have no taste at all.  I resorted to tomato soup and marmite on toast, and by the way I hate marmite but loved it while on Docetaxel.  Bovril with boiling water is great as well. Think I spent a few weeks with a diet of tomato soup and marmite.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Mrs50 I did get a swollen ankle after chemo but oncologist put it down to starting tamoxifen, I had it for a few weeks until I got used to the tamoxifen. I would ask though as any puffy bits could mean clots, I know this because while having chemo my hand and forearm were feeling a bit strange, I thought it was a bit swollen but doc on chemo ward said it was ok. Following week I saw oncologist and told him I had been back to chemo unit as my hand felt strange. He ordered a special ultrasound scan for the next day and yes I had 3 blood clots around my picc line, so always check.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Miss Wolfie Hi there, hope your first chemo is not giving you bad side effects.   I had grade 3 stage 3  invasive breast cancer ER and PR plus. I had 20/22 nodes involved. I had full right mastectomy, then 6 x FEC T chemo at 3 week intervals then 15 blasts of radiotherapy. I finished all my treatment in June 2018 and am clear of breast cancer at the moment.  I am on Tamoxifen as I had not quite gone through the menopause at the time but got appointment for Oncology in July to have a break so they can test to see If I need to be swapped to letrozol. Good luck hun, message me if I can help you at all
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: PicaPica Hi hun I have only been using the cbd cream for about 6 weeks but I have been using it on my joints as well as getting pain from tamoxifen.  I tried a sample of the cbd cream from a website called  cbdbrothers. It is a bit expensive to buy but I have now bought the green cbd paste from them and make my own cbd cream which is far cheaper. I am having some success with the cream, before I felt like I had concrete in my chest, it now feels a little lighter and not so restrictive. I am not waking in the night to turn over any more. You know the way it works, is it the cbd cream or is it just the healing process, well I am going to continue with the cream as its not doing me any harm. I am 1 year post op october.
Posts.Title: Tightness in chest, now 10 months post-op

Posts.Content: Mrs C ,PicaPica  hi ladies, I have had some problems with a tight chest also, just thought it was normal, seems to have got worse after radiotherapy. I have been using a CBD cream which has helped a bit. Hope you find something to help you.
Posts.Title: Tightness in chest, now 10 months post-op

Posts.Content: Hi all Think I may have been one of the lucky ones, only had slight redness on zap 14 and 15, but 10 days later was glowing, itchy and small blisters. Was told no more cream let it dry out.  I did this and in 7 days it had started to go brown and a bit crispy. Over the next 7 days it started peeling and is now just a different colour. I was told no extremes of temperature so no hot showers or ice packs.
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi panagram I think the 5 years or 10 years was how long you are likely to be on your medication, my surgeon told me 10 years of tamoxifen after surgery. I think you should talk to your doctor about changing medication as the side effects are far to great for you to have quality of life.   Perhaps get a second opinion , perhaps an alternative therapy would be more beneficial.  You need support and your GP should be able to give you an honest overview and point you in the right direction for the help you need. Big hugs
Posts.Title: I don't understand my prognosis/what my future is

Posts.Content: taralou Hi hun I am in the south east as well, I had 15 rads and after 6th was seen by skin nurse who checked me over and answered any questions I had, again the same after 11th radiotherapy, then after care appointment 12 days after. Think it's different ever where. Now 14 days post rads and very sore and itchy and quite puffy.  Hope it starts to feel better soon, even took ibuprophen today as it was bad.  I have had a mastectomy and have been unable to wear a bra for the last 6 days.
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: HClare Woop Woop, congratulations for getting through rads, don't forget you may continue to cook for the next 10/14 days. X
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: maggiemee Hi hun, hair on my head started to come out 2 weeks after 1st chemo, by chemo 3 my eyebrows were all but gone and top eye lashes gone. After chemo 4 I had no brows, lashes or body hair.  My last chemo was 9th April, I now have full set of lashes, patchy brows and full covering of head hair but obviously very short.  I do think everyone is different and we all just have to have a little patience
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  I had my check up appointment today after finishing rads 12 days ago. Still very very red, got two very sore bits, just in the crease under my arm and slap being in the middle of chest. Nurse said to stop with the cream as it needs to dry out, I have some swelling which nurse was not worried about, what she said is that my body reacts to it as a burn so sends fluid to the area. She gave me a dressing to put on sore bits so I don't knock or scratch as she said my skin will be very easily damaged at the moment. She told me to wash off the cream and air dry.  Wow am I feeling tight and crispy now. Feel like I want to slather on the cream
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Moomc Yes completely understand, but it is lovely not having to visit the hospital on a weekly/daily basis. As my oncologist said to me, if you have a problem call the breast care nurse and she will get you in to see us, she said she could see me once a month but the chances of her picking anything up in clinic is very slim as most things are picked up by the person who then makes a appointment. Same with scans a scan is only good for the day you have it, as changes can occur the very next day. Be vigilant and don't be afraid to call if you have a problem.  Well done for getting through rads.
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Congratulations to XjulieX, Moomc and Israel.  Hope you all rang that Bell loud and proud x
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Tigermum Hi hun I think it's different for everyone but I still have some numbness under my arm and around my scar line. IT HAS got better as it was to my elbow but I still have to spray deodorant while looking in the mirror because i cant feel it.
Posts.Title: Hard lump post mastectomy

Posts.Content: Tigermum Hi hun I would call your breast care nurse and have it looked at, its the only way you are going to have peace of mind.  I also had a large seroma which I had drained twice as it was causing me discomfort.  The idea is to try to let your body do the work of dispersing the fluid.  The fluid is normal fluid which would have gone through the breast but as your breast is now gone the body has to try to find a way of getting rid of the fluid.  I had full node clearance and mine was 20/22 were cancerous so I went on to have 6 X FEC T Chemotherapy and then 15 cycles of Radiotherapy.  My surgery was October 2017, chemo started December and ended April and Radiotherapy started and ended June.  Just at the point where I am noticing how unfit I have got and now realise that its going to be a long road to try to get some stamina back.  But I have just bought myself a fit bit watch and going to see if I can gradually increase my steps. Hope you are doing well and yes come on here and ask anything there is always someone to talk to.
Posts.Title: Hard lump post mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Patterbelle  I was diagnosed with invasive duct cancer grade 3 aggressive on 4th sept.  I was given a MRI scan and had a right mastectomy on 2nd October.  They also found another cluster of agressive cancer after they did the histology on my breast.  I had a sentinel node biopsy and cancer was present so they did a axilla clearance and removed 22 nodes.  Cancer was in 20/22.  I had a CT scan 2 weeks ago it was clear.  I had a bone scan last week I just got results its clear.  due to start chemo in about 3 weeks.  Its not all doom and gloom.  She needs you to be positive for her because I can tell you I was feeling very negative, you just need to support her and you need to talk to someone to support you, talking does help.  sending love and best wishes to you both.
Posts.Title: So scared

Posts.Content: hugle32  Bless you hun, you are a wonderful daughter. I have just finished chemo and want to tell you it is hard but she can do it.  Tell mum to listen to the chemo nurses, when they give anti sick meds take them, even if you don't feel sick, it's easier to prevent than it is to treat.  My taste did go funny, for a week or so every cycle I could only eat tomato soup, I used to be a coffee drinker but during chemo I hated it, if I wanted a hot drink I had bovril.  Mum must drink 2ltrs  of water every day to flush the chemo out, I found adding orange or lemon a lot easier, I started drinking 2ltrs a day 3 weeks before chemo started, that way I was already used to it, it can be hard some days. Rest is very important, but try to go to bed and rest not sleep in the chair, that way she will rest properly. Please please call the chemo unit if you have any problems, they can't help if you don't tell them.
Posts.Title: preparing my mum for chemo

Posts.Content: Hi there  I am in Essex and while I was having a MX they did a SNB and got the results straight away, this meant they went ahead and did axillary clearance as there was cancer in the biopsy. I got told histology results in 2 weeks and when I went back they checked the wound and said sorry results not back we will see you next week. So i still had to wait.   I am very glad that I was able to have all the surgery I needed in one go.  The wait for you both must be very difficult Stay strong
Posts.Title: Waiting for results is the worst

Posts.Content: Brilliant news Keep your arm up as much as much as you can.  When you dry your arm or moisturise only do that in a upward stroke.  Dry from elbow up to shoulder in long soft strokes and then from wrist up to elbow, this will also help Keep pushing for lymphedema clinic Stay strong
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Hello Hides If you can sleep with your arm above your head that will help as well.  I need another pillow at an angle above my head to rest my arm on, the way it works is wrist higher than elbow, elbow higher than shoulder. and elbow and wrist higher than heart.  It does help honest. stay strong
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: silversilver I got mine from Boots, it was a scan the forehead one and quite reasonable. Worked well for me and now I can scan the grandkids while they sleep if I need to. One Doc did tell me they were not very reliable so he gave me lots of packets of the throw away ones, I tested the scanner and the throw away ones and they were always the same so just scanned from then on.  Think we have far to muck to worry about and need to make it quick and easy.
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: To everyone who is going through chemo I just wanted to say  You got this, you are all strong beautiful ladies. I am still reading the Chemo thread 1 year after finishing my Chemo just to see if there is any thing I can add to make your chemo journey a bit easier. Looks like you are all managing well. Well done
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: NiceCuppa hi hun, I finished chemo 9th April last year, I did radiotherapy beg of June and when I finished radio I had enough hair to cover my head so did not wear my hats.  I have had numerous hair cuts as mine grew back curly, it's back to normal now though and getting in my eyes lol. You have to be patient though as getting any length is taking it's time as you have to remember the bit on top of your head is going to need a lot more time to catch up to the bit at the back of your neck. Mine also grew back very uneven, one side so much longer than the other, just needed lots of trims. Good luck
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Jo36 Yes just reply to anyone's post and there will be someone to talk to you or help with your journey. It is a roller coaster ride but you will get through it with support from your family and everyone on here who has or is going through it. If you need any advice or help just message me hun, I finished chemo in Apri and radiotherapy in June.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Haysie oh wow you look wonderful, what a beautifully shaped head you have, you rock that bald head x
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Baduki1 Hi hun, I had sentinel node biopsy while I was having MX although nodes looked ok on scan there was cancer cells.so they went ahead and removed 22 nodes. 20/22 had cancer cells. I went on to have chemo and radiotherapy  Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Baduki1 Hi hun, yes I have now finished all my treatment. I have not had any signs of lymphodema at all but was told by my surgeon after MX that I must protect my arm on that side at all times, no sun, no shoulder bags, no hoovering, no lifting not even the kettle.  I massage my arm everyday with cream to keep moistureised from the elbow to under my arm then from wrist to elbow, i do this also when drying.  My surgeon also told me to sleep with my arm above my head for the first few months to help the drainage. I followed what he said and have not had any problems. I had my MX October 2017. Over time as I have healed I have started to do more and now do most things but never never pick up any thing heavy as I could still give myself lymphodema. Hope your well
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Baduki1 Hi hun, I had sentinel node biopsy while I was having MX although nodes looked ok on scan there was cancer cells.so they went ahead and removed 22 nodes. 20/22 had cancer cells. I went on to have chemo and radiotherapy  Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Baduki1 Hi hun, yes I have now finished all my treatment. I have not had any signs of lymphodema at all but was told by my surgeon after MX that I must protect my arm on that side at all times, no sun, no shoulder bags, no hoovering, no lifting not even the kettle.  I massage my arm everyday with cream to keep moistureised from the elbow to under my arm then from wrist to elbow, i do this also when drying.  My surgeon also told me to sleep with my arm above my head for the first few months to help the drainage. I followed what he said and have not had any problems. I had my MX October 2017. Over time as I have healed I have started to do more and now do most things but never never pick up any thing heavy as I could still give myself lymphodema. Hope your well
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer spread to Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Just finished a few bits for a new baby boy due next week, loved doing them
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: A football supporters mascot that I made in the summer.
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Well I have zap 15 tomorrow my last one. Have not had any real issues while having radiotherapy, everyone has been lovely. My routine has been wash with soap and tepid water before I go, get zapped, I put R1 gel all over the area and cover with a cotton cloth before getting bra on. Once I am home I pur r2 cream on and do not put bra back on, I use r2 cream again after shower and again before I go to bed. I then start again the next day. I am red today but only one more to go so think I have done really well.   I know some ladies struggle with radiotherapy but it has been kind to me so far. I hope it is kind to everyone
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Well zap 11 done today, just 4 left now. Had to see radiologist for a consult after zap 11 Today.  Skin looks ok at the moment, little bit red for a few hours then that has gone by the morning.   Thought I was a bit puffy around the scar site but radiologist compared a pic from zap 1 to now and said no you are not swollen it's all good, so r1 and r2 are doing a wonderful job Hope everyone is doing well
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: @Leolady56 Congratulations on getting through your treatments. I have had a hell of a time trying to post today, would not let me tag either. Hope everyone is doing ok,
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi all I had my 1st of 15 zaps today, very red already.  I did use the R1 and R2 cream, and tried it for 3 days before to make sure I was ok with it.  My neck got quite stiff while I was on the table and my left arm went numb.  Hope it's easier tomorrow.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Leolady56  Thanks hun have fished out my exercise sheet and trying to do them at least twice a day, RT today was a bit easier but to be honest I think they got me set up a lot faster today so was not left for what seems a life time with my arms up.  Does anyone else have the gel slab on there chest while having RT, I was told it was to stop it going too deep as I had a mastectomy.  Hope everyone is not pink and not sore x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: OCRKate Hi hun, oh don't be scared. I had mine removed but SNB was done and tested while I was in surgery so had axillary clearance while I was there. There are lots who have to go back for a second op. Think Leolady56 may be more help than me. Good luck, try not to worry.
Posts.Title: Axillary Lymph Node Clearance

Posts.Content: I know how you feel, I convinced myself I had cancer in my elbow as it suddenly became sore. Oh told me I had been using the computer too much.  After bone scan was clear I just broke down with relief. Started working myself up again waiting for chemo start date and had a mini melt down when I got the letter a couple of days ago. I don' think you can stop your brain from doing it its human nature.   Don' think I have been to breast clinic lately without crying, I cry when it' bad news and cry when it' good news. The oncologist asked me why I was crying and I told him I don' want cancer that's why, you stupid man.  It' easy to say don' worry it' a lot harder to do Good luck Friday
Posts.Title: Stressed/Anxious

Posts.Content: taralou Hi hun hope your ok, no never had that, they did come back in on one occasion and say they needed to move me, which did a while for them to get me right.  I think that they should all be made to get on the table and have there arms up for at least 20 mins and then maybe would be a bit more considerate. Don't think it is your fault hun think they did not get you right in the first place.  I wiggled my fingers and they gave me soft balls to hold. Hope it's better tomorrow
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?

Posts.Content: Hi lynn151 Please seek medical advice, I had a painful swollen hand and forearm after 2 weeks I found out I had 3 blood clots in my arm, these could have been very serious and should have been investigated a lot sooner than they was DVT's are dangerous  Stay strong
Posts.Title: Pain in arm chemo fec was given 9 dsys ago

Posts.Content: Hi all I take tamoxifen and at first my joints were very painfull. I was told to change brands of tamoxifen which I did and joint pain went away also I did get puffy ankles but this has now gone. I have been on tamoxifen now for 3 months with no further issues..
Posts.Title: Refusing Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi hun have not seen you on for a while, just checking you are ok, hope things are going well for you. stay strong hun
Posts.Title: Primary occult breast cancer - anyone else??

Posts.Content: Shooper  Hi hun, I finished 3 x FEC 3 x T April 9th.  The change in taste is not nice, it's the one thing that is hard to change, strong flavours can be ok but to be honest my taste just got worse as chemo went on. I tried things like hot bovril when I did not like coffee anymore, marmite on toast and rolls when everything else was tasting off. Throughout T my taste went AWOL I think i bought up all the tins of tomato soup from my local shop as it was all I could eat for a while.  Fresh orange juice with lemonade was another. You will end up buying loads of things that you fancy then dont like but dont bin anything as your taste will change again very quickly. Hope you are feeling well.
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi  As far as I am aware a ductectomy is one duct removed , I had a total duct excision and just had some discomfort for a few days. They went in just under the nipple, internal stitches and glue on top healed very quickly Good luck
Posts.Title: Ductectomy - what should I expect?

Posts.Content: Hi lelotron Glad you went to your gp. I know you said you have appointment Wednesday is that for breast unit or gp, because my surgeon would have had a melt down if a gp touched his steri  strips.  I hope your appointment for Wednesday is for your surgeon, after I had a total duct excision I was very bruised but not swollen. Did your gp say why you were dizzy, ok he gave you meds but what's the cause.   Hope you get sorted Stay strong girls
Posts.Title: Ductectomy - what should I expect?

Posts.Content: Hi lelotron I am hoping you have either been back to the breast clinic or been to see your GP. This does not sound right and needs to be looked at. Do it now if you have not already done it please love x
Posts.Title: Ductectomy - what should I expect?

Posts.Content: Hi shellian I think you need some extra support and so does your partner, there are support groups you can attend and also support on the telephone.  Find your nearest group, it will give you people who like you are struggling and sometimes people who have been through this and come out the other side can be the best support ever.  You will make new friends to replace the ones who are finding it difficult to support you.  Your partner needs support as well, I have found a group that family and friends can attend as well, lets not forget we are not going through this on our own and sometimes our partners feel they have to be so strong for us that they don't take care of themselves. please contact someone who can help other than family or friends, sometimes its what we need, a shoulder to cry on that is not going to judge or think we are weak.  someone who will just listen. stay strong, keep posting
Posts.Title: Never been as low

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose Well done for getting through your chemo.  You cry as much as you want to and where you want to and if anyone says anything you put them in touch with us lot on here.  Yes good idea try to keep busy but try to be gentle with yourself, this chemo train is a emotional rollercoaster, one min we are ok the next we are in meltdown. Let your friends and family support you in this time of need. Stay strong lovely
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose  Oh hun I am so pleased you managed to do mum proud. Now you need to rest and regain your strength. Big gentle hugs
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose Your post sounded so desperate, you are never alone in this, we are all here to hold you up and support you.  I know we can all have times when we think we can't do this, I had one just after chemo cycle 4, but here I am just finished cycle 6.  Breast Cancer and everything it throws at you is hard, but you are a fighter and you have to arm yourself for the next battle, ever battle you win brings you one step closer to winning the war. Your husband and family have to endure watching you battle this every day and it will make them feel helpless.  Try not to battle them but let them support you in any way they can. Tell them how much you love them because they sure do love you, and sometimes it can be harder on them to watch you fight. Come on here to have a moan and a cry,  we all do it and you will get so much love and support to keep you going.  You can do this, we can do this,  Stay strong lovely, we all have melt downs.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Yes I had a blood clot and have been on stomach injections everyday.     I have now had my last chemo and still need the injections until the end of the month and then can change over yo tablet blood thinner for the next 5 months. Stay strong
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose My heart is breaking for you my lovely. You need some big gentle hugs. Yes the nurses will look after you I am sure. I am just lost for words, you went to visit her and hugged and kissed her, she knew you loved her. She also knew what you were going to have to go through and I am sure would want you to go a head and have your chemo. Be gentle with yourself You are in my thoughts.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sammystaff When mine started to fall out my hubby shaved it for me, I do wish that I had not shaved it off but only cut it very short.  It was very Spikey and uncomfortable for a few weeks where I shaved it. My advice would be cut it short and let it fall out as it needs too. Stay strong
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all SE day 5 cycle 6 have been manageable. Has anyone noticed any yellowing of there teeth, just noticed this morning mine look grim.  I did see dentist before chemo started and it may be that I just need them cleaned but they do look horrid. Ruby Rose Hope your doing ok today, take it slow my lovely. Stay strong
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Mam to 3  Hi hun, yes injections after chemo, they are quick and easy to give but the first few did make my stomach ache. I did one left side next day one right side. GCSF injections can give you incredible bone ache so I was told to have them at night and if they did cause pain to start a antihistamine called clarityn. Which would help some people. It did not help me so second chemo they gave me lenograstim injections instead of filgrastim which really helped.  The injections are easy to use just pinch your tummy and go in the pinch, does not hurt at all. Stay strong lovely
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Mam to 3  Hi hun all I can tell you about FEC is take your anti sick even if you don't feel sick for 3 days. If you do feel sick and the meds don't work, call the unit and they will change meds. If you get heartburn or indigestion take something right away, if this is a problem the chemo nurse will give you a once a day tablet.  Don't suffer in silence call the unit. Good luck hun, it is hard but you will get through it, make sure you get lots of help at home as you will be very tired and out of breath and watch out for going from constipated to can't stop in a very short space of time. Stay strong lovely
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Leolady56  My picc line flush and or bloods are done by the district nurse who comes to my home. I did read the other day that you have to have BP done on your lower arm or leg I believe, my local hospital and hospital where I have chemo and RT take blood pressure straight over picc line, it does not hurt. Thought it was standard practice  Hope you are well
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
